name: AR Hwacha
description: The Singijeongi Hwacha (Fire Wagon) is among the oldest rocket weapons in the world with detailed records of its use. The wagon is the world's first mobile rocket type weapon, recorded as being built in 1448. Its body was made of wood, and would launch a multitude of rocket-propelled arrows (singijeon) simultaneously when fired. When firing, the angle of the wagon could be adjusted, and ignition wires could be strung to either launch each row of arrows individually, or launch the entire wagon’s arsenal at once in a devastating flurry.
